gold.testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.

reasoning: Fact 1: The witness claims he saw shadows on the ritual curtain.
Fact 2: The evidence suggests the moon was directly above the summit of Mt. Poniponi.
Fact 3: The context suggests the witness was at the top of Mt. Poniponi.
Prop 1: If a light source is directly above an observer, it will cast shadows of an observed object on the opposite side of the observer.
Prop 2: If the observed object is surrounded by curtains, an outside observer cannot see the shadows cast on the opposite side of the curtains.

source.context_span:
Nichody:
...Very well. This is what I heard directly from Master Sorin himself. As you surmised, Master Sorin was stabbed by Gloomsbury on the day of the murder. It happened after the first wedding reception. The happy couple was in the reception hall when, suddenly, Gloomsbury appeared... He attacked Miss Ellen and tried to take her away. Master Sorin went to stop him, and found himself in a struggle with Gloomsbury. That is when Master Sorin was stabbed with the candelabra, he said.

gold.testimony: In the hold, I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern.
